text: John Hardy Borrough (1913-1944) was a male rower who competed for England. ==Rowing career== Burrough represented England and won a gold medal in the eights at the 1938 British Empire Games in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. ==Personal life== He was an works control chemist (distillery and winery) by trade and lived in Downs Avenue, Epsom during 1938. He was killed during World War II, in 1944 when serving as a Flight Lieutenant with the Royal Air Force and is commemorated at the Runnymeade Memorial. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1944 deaths Category:English male rowers Category:Boxers at the 1938 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in rowing Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for England
title: John Burrough (rower)
